results.definition: give a certain impression or have a certain outward aspect
examples: This appears to be a very difficult problem
They appeared like people who had not eaten or slept for a long time
Did your latest book appear yet?

results.definition: come into being or existence, or appear on the scene
examples: Homo sapiens appeared millions of years ago

results.definition: seem to be true, probable, or apparent
examples: It appears that the weather in California is very bad

results.definition: appear as a character on stage or appear in a play, etc.
examples: Gielgud appears briefly in this movie
She appeared in `Hamlet' on the London stage
He suddenly appeared at the wedding
A new star appeared on the horizon

results.definition: present oneself formally, as before a (judicial) authority
examples: He had to appear in court last month
She appeared on several charges of theft
